meanings.definition: The domain or territory of a seignior.
meanings.sent1: The seigniory of the king included vast lands and castles.
meanings.sent2: The seigniory of the nobleman extended across the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The seigniory of the farmer was so large, he needed a map to find his way around.
meanings.sent4: In her imagination, the seigniory of the queen stretched to the ends of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The seigniory of the knight was a place of honor and valor.

meanings.definition: The rank or authority of a seignior.
meanings.sent1: His seigniory over the village allowed him to make important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The king's seigniory was unquestioned by his subjects.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed seigniory over the house, demanding attention from everyone.
meanings.sent4: With a wave of his hand, he asserted his seigniory over the meeting.
meanings.sent5: Her seigniory in the classroom made her the go-to person for help.

meanings.definition: The estate or lands of a seignior.
meanings.sent1: The seigniory of the lord was filled with fields of golden wheat.
meanings.sent2: The seigniory of the baron was known for its lush forests and sparkling rivers.
meanings.sent3: The seigniory of the wealthy merchant was the envy of all his neighbors.
meanings.sent4: She inherited the seigniory of her ancestors, a vast expanse of fertile land.
meanings.sent5: The seigniory of the duke was a place of beauty and tranquility.
